landmark-unique:
To ensure landmarks have a unique role or role/label/title, you should use appropriate HTML elements, ARIA roles, and attributes to differentiate each landmark on the page. This helps assistive technologies, like screen readers, to identify and announce the landmarks for better accessibility. Here's an example of how to create unique landmarks using HTML5 elements and ARIA roles: ```html Unique Landmarks Example

Main Header

  • Home
  • About
  • Services
  • Contact

Related Articles

  • Article 1
  • Article 2
  • Article 3

Article Title

Article content...

© 2021 - Company Name

``` In this example: - The `
` element has a role of "banner" and represents the main header of the page. - The `
` element has a role of "navigation" and an `aria-label` of "Primary" to indicate it's the primary navigation menu. - The `
` element has a role of "complementary" and an `aria-label` of "Related Articles" to indicate it contains related articles. - The `
` element has a role of "main" and represents the main content of the page. - The `
` element has a role of "contentinfo" and
